question: [ES] What are the differences between hard disk drives and solid state disks? (Choose two.)
options: [ES] Hard disks can fail due to physical damage, while solid state disks cannot fail.
[ES] Solid state disks can store many times as much data as hard disk drives.
[ES] /dev/sda is a hard disk device while /dev/ssda is a solid state disk.
[ES] Solid state disks provide faster access to stored data than hard disks.
[ES] Hard disks have a motor and moving parts, solid state disks do not.
answer: [ES] Hard disks have a motor and moving parts, solid state disks do not.
[ES] Solid state disks provide faster access to stored data than hard disks.

question: [ES] Members of a team already have experience using Red Hat Enterprise Linux. For a small hobby project, the team wants to set up a Linux server without paying for a subscription. Which of the following Linux distributions allows the team members to apply as much of their Red Hat Enterprise Linux knowledge as possible?
[ES] Reverse DNS assigns hostnames to IP addresses. How is the name of the IP address 198.51.100.165 stored on a DNS server?
options: [ES] In the REV record for arpa.in-addr.198.51.100.165.

question: [ES] Which of the following types of bus can connect hard disk drives with the motherboard?
[ES] Which of the following commands can be used to resolve a DNS name to an IP address?
[ES] What information can be displayed by top?
options: [ES] User accounts, ordered by the number of files.
[ES] Running processes, ordered by CPU or RAM consumption.
[ES] User accounts, ordered by the number of logins.
[ES] User groups, ordered by the number of members.
[ES] Existing files, ordered by their size.
answer: [ES] Running processes, ordered by CPU or RAM consumption.

question: [ES] Which of the following outputs comes from the command free?
options: [ES] A. 21:04 up 14 dats, 7:43, 3 users, load average: 0.89, 1.00, 0.99

[ES] Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on 
/dev/nvme0n1p2  468G   33G  412G   8% /

[ES] total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:            15Gi       2.3Gi         9Gi       910Mi       3.0Gi        11Gi
Swap:          2.0Gi          0B       2.0Gi
answer:
[ES] total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:            15Gi       2.3Gi         9Gi       910Mi       3.0Gi        11Gi
Swap:          2.0Gi          0B       2.0Gi

question: [ES] What is true about the dmesg command? (Choose two.)
options: [ES] It might not display older information because it was overwritten by newer information.
[ES] It sends messages to the command lines of all current user sessions.
[ES] It traces the execution of a command and shows each step the program carries out.
[ES] It displays the content of the Linux kernel’s ring buffer.
[ES] It immediately outputs all new messages written to the system journal.
answer: [ES] It displays the content of the Linux kernel’s ring buffer.
[ES] It might not display older information because it was overwritten by newer information.

question: [ES] Which of the following outputs could stem from the command last?
options: [ES] Password for user last changed at Sat Mar 31 16:38:57 EST 2018
[ES] Last login: Fri Mar 23 10:56:39 2018 from server.example.com
[ES] EXT4-fs(dm7): mountes filesystem with ordered data mode. Opts: (null)

question: [ES] What is true about the owner of a file?
options: [ES] The user owning a file must be a member of the file’s group.
[ES] The owner of a file cannot be changed once it is assigned to an owner.
[ES] Each file is owned by exactly one user and one group.
[ES] The owner of a file always has full permissions when accessing the file.
[ES] When a user is deleted, all files owned by the user disappear.
answer: [ES] Each file is owned by exactly one user and one group.

question: [ES] What is the UID of the user root?
[ES] Which permissions are set on a regular file once the permissions have been modified with the command chmod 654 file.txt?
[ES] Which of the following tar options handle compression? (Choose two.)
[ES] Which of the following permissions are set on the /tmp/ directory?
[ES] What information is stored in /etc/passwd? (Choose three.)
[ES] Which command adds the new user tux and creates the user’s home directory with default configuration files?
[ES] Which of the following commands creates an archive file work.tar from the contents of the directory ./work/?
[ES] The current directory contains the following file: -rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 859688 Feb 7 08:15 test.sh Given that the file is a valid shell script, how can this script be executed? (Choose two.)
[ES] Which of the following keys can be pressed to exit less?
[ES] What keyword is used in a shell script to begin a loop? (Specify one keyword only, without any additional information.)
[ES] Which of the following commands will search for the file foo.txt under the directory /home?
[ES] A directory contains the following files: a.txt and b.txt, What would be the output of the following shell script? for file in *.txt

[ES] The current directory contains the following file: -rw-r—r— 1 root exec 24551 Apr 2 12:36 test.sh The file contains a valid shell script, but executing this file using ./test.sh leads to this error: bash: ./test.sh: Permission denied What should be done in order to successfully execute the script?
options: [ES] The file’s extension should be changed from .sh to .bin.
[ES] The script should be run using #!./test. sh instead of ./test.sh.
[ES] The execute bit should be set in the file’s permissions.
[ES] The user executing the script should be added to the exec group.
[ES] The SetUID bit should be set in the file’s permissions
answer: [ES] The execute bit should be set in the file’s permissions.

question: [ES] Which of the following commands sorts the output of the command export-logs?
[ES] What is a Linux distribution?
options: [ES] A set of changes to Linux which enable Linux to run on another processor architecture.
[ES] An operating system based on Linux but incompatible to the regular Linux kernel.
[ES] The Linux file system as seen from the root account after mounting all file systems.
[ES] The set of rules which governs the distribution of Linux kernel source code.
[ES] A bundling of the Linux kernel, system utilities and other software.
answer: [ES] A bundling of the Linux kernel, system utilities and other software.

question: [ES] Where is the operating system of a Raspberry Pi stored?
options: [ES] On a removable SD card which is put into the Raspberry Pi.
[ES] On rewritable flash storage which is built into the Raspberry Pi.
[ES] On a read only partition on the Raspberry Pi’s firmware, next to the BIOS.
[ES] On the master device attached to the Raspberry Pi’s IDE bus.
[ES] On a Linux extension module connected to the Raspberry Pi’s GPIO pins.
answer: [ES] On a removable SD card which is put into the Raspberry Pi.

question: [ES] Which of the following programs is a graphical editor for vector graphics?
[ES] Which package management tool is used in Red Hat-based Linux Systems?
[ES] Which of the following characters in a shell prompt indicates the shell is running with root privileges?
[ES] Which of the following are typical services offered by public cloud providers? (Choose three.)
[ES] What is defined by a Free Software license?
options: [ES] Conditions for modifying and distributing the licensed software.
[ES] Details of the technical documentation each contributor has to provide.
[ES] A complete list of libraries required to compile the licensed software.
[ES] The programming languages which may be used to extend the licensed program.
[ES] Limits on the purposes for which the licensed software may be used.
answer: [ES] Conditions for modifying and distributing the licensed software.

question: [ES] Why are web browser cookies considered dangerous?
options: [ES] Cookies store critical data which is lost when a cookie is deleted.
[ES] Cookies are always public and accessible to anyone on the internet.
[ES] Cookies support identification and tracking of users.
[ES] Cookies can contain and execute viruses and malware.
[ES] Cookies consume significant amounts of storage and can exhaust disk space.
answer: [ES] Cookies support identification and tracking of users.

question: [ES] Running the command rm Downloads leads to the following error: rm: cannot remove ‘Downloads/’: Is a directory Which of the following commands can be used instead to remove Downloads, assuming Downloads is empty? (Choose two.)
[ES] What is true about a recursive directory listing?
options: [ES] It includes ownership information for the files.
[ES] It includes details of file system internals, such as inodes.
[ES] It includes a preview of content for each file in the directory.
[ES] It includes the content of sub-directories.
[ES] It includes the permissions of the directory listed.
answer: [ES] It includes the content of sub-directories.

question: [ES] Which of the following commands are used to get information on the proper use of ls? (Choose two.)
[ES] Which of the following directories contains information, documentation and example configuration files for installed software packages?
[ES] A user is currently in the directory /home/user/Downloads/ and runs the command ls ../Documents/ Assuming it exists, which directory’s content is displayed?
[ES] Which of the following commands adds the directory /new/dir/ to the PATH environment variable?
[ES] A directory contains the following three files: texts 1.txt texts 2.txt texts 3.csv Which command copies the two files ending in .txt to the /tmp/ directory?
[ES] When typing a long command line at the shell, what single character can be used to split a command across multiple lines?
[ES] Which of the following DNS record types hold an IP address? (Choose two.)
[ES] Which of the following values could be a process ID on Linux?
[ES] Which of the following is a protocol used for automatic IP address configuration?
[ES] Which of the following devices represents a hard disk partition?
[ES] Which of the following statements regarding Linux hardware drivers is correct?
options: [ES] Drivers are regular Linux programs which have to be run by the user who wants to use a device.
[ES] Drivers are not used by Linux because the BIOS handles all access to hardware on behalf of Linux.
[ES] Drivers are stored on their devices and are copied by the Linux kernel when a new device is attached
[ES] Drivers are downloaded from the vendor's driver repository when a new device is attached.
[ES] Drivers are either compiled into the Linux kernel or are loaded as kernel modules.
answer: [ES] Drivers are either compiled into the Linux kernel or are loaded as kernel modules.

question: [ES] What can be found in the /proc/ directory?
options: [ES] One file per existing user account.
[ES] One log file per running service.

question:
[ES] A new server needs to be installed to host services for a period of several years. Throughout this time, the server should receive important
security updates from its Linux distribution.
Which of the following Linux distributions meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
[ES] Which of the following directories must be mounted with read and write access if it resides on its own dedicated file system?
[ES] The ownership of the file doku.odt should be changed. The new owner is named tux. Which command accomplishes this change?
[ES] What happens to a file residing outside the home directory when the file owner's account is deleted? (Choose two.)
options: [ES] During a file system check, the file is moved to /lost +found.
[ES] The file is removed from the file system.
[ES] The UID of the former owner is shown when listing the file's details.
[ES] The user root is set as the new owner of the file.
[ES] Ownership and permissions of the file remain unchanged.
answer: [ES] The UID of the former owner is shown when listing the file's details.
[ES] Ownership and permissions of the file remain unchanged.

question: [ES] Which statements about the directory /etc/skel are correct? (Choose two.)
options: [ES] The personal user settings of root are stored in this directory.
[ES] The files from the directory are copied to the home directory of the new user when starting the system.
[ES] The files from the directory are copied to the home directory of a new user when the account is created.
[ES] The directory contains a default set of configuration files used by the useradd command.
[ES] The directory contains the global settings for the Linux system.
answer: [ES] The files from the directory are copied to the home directory of a new user when the account is created.
[ES] The directory contains a default set of configuration files used by the useradd command.

question: [ES] What is true about links in a Linux file system?
options: [ES] A symbolic link can only point to a file and not to a directory.
[ES] A hard link can only point to a directory and never to a file.
[ES] When the target of the symbolic link is moved, the link is automatically updated.
[ES] A symbolic link can point to a file on another file system.
[ES] Only the root user can create hard links.
answer: [ES] A symbolic link can point to a file on another file system.

question:
[ES] Which files are the source of the information in the following output? (Choose two.) uid=1000 (bob) gid=1000 (bob) groups=1000 (bob), 10
(wheel), 150 (wireshark), 989 (docker), 1001 (libvirt)
[ES] Which of the following tasks can the command passwd accomplish? (Choose two.)
[ES] What is true about the su command?
options: [ES] It is the default shell of the root account.
[ES] It can only be used by the user root.
[ES] It runs a shell or command as another user.
[ES] It changes the name of the main administrator account.
[ES] It locks the root account in specific time frames.
answer: [ES] It runs a shell or command as another user.

question: [ES] What parameter of ls prints a recursive listing of a directory's content? (Specify ONLY the option name without any values or parameters.)
[ES] Most commands on Linux can display information on their usage. How can this information typically be displayed?
options: [ES] By running the command with the option /? or /??.
[ES] By running the command with the option ?! or ?=!.
[ES] By running the command with the option /doc or /documentation.
[ES] By running the command with the option -h or --help.
[ES] By running the command with the option -m or --manpage.
answer: [ES] By running the command with the option -h or --help.

question: [ES] Which of the following commands shows the absolute path to the current working directory?
[ES] Which of the following commands output the content of the file Texts 2.txt? (Choose two.)
[ES] Which command displays file names only and no additional information?
[ES] What is the purpose of the PATH environment variable?
options: [ES] It allows the execution of commands without the need to know the location of the executable.
[ES] It increases security by preventing commands from running in certain locations.
[ES] It specifies the location of a user's home directory.
[ES] It indicates the location of the default shell to be used when a user logs in.
[ES] It contains the absolute path to the current directory.
answer: [ES] It allows the execution of commands without the need to know the location of the executable.

question: [ES] Which of the following commands sets the variable USERNAME to the value bob?
[ES] What command displays manual pages?
[ES] Which command copies the contents of the directory /etc/, including all sub-directories, to /root/?
[ES] Which of the following commands puts the lines of the file data.csv into alphabetical order?
[ES] Which of the following examples shows the general structure of a for loop in a shell script?
options: [ES] for file in *.txt do echo $i done
answer: [ES] for file in *.txt do echo $i done

question: [ES] Which operator in a regular expression matches the preceding character either zero or one time?

[ES] The file script.sh in the current directory contains the following content:
#!/bin/bash
echo $MYVAR
The following commands are used to execute this script:


MYVAR=value -
./script.sh
The result is an empty line instead of the content of the variable MYVAR. How should MYVAR be set in order to make script.sh display the content
of MYVAR?
[ES] What is the return value of a shell script after successful execution?
[ES] Which of the following commands creates the ZIP archive poems.zip containing all files in the current directory whose names end in .txt?
[ES] Which of the following statements are true regarding a typical shell script? (Choose two.)
options: [ES] It has the executable permission bit set.
[ES] It starts with the two character sequence #!.
[ES] It is compiled into a binary file compatible with the current machine architecture.
answer: [ES] It has the executable permission bit set.
[ES] It starts with the two character sequence #!.

question: [ES] Which of the following commands extracts the contents of the compressed archive file1.tar.gz?
[ES] Which of the following commands finds all lines in the file operating-systems.txt which contain the term linux, regardless of the case?
[ES] Which one of the following statements concerning Linux passwords is true?
options: [ES] All passwords can be decrypted using the system administrator's master password.
[ES] Passwords may never start with a non-letter.
[ES] Users cannot change their password once it has been set.
[ES] Passwords are only stored in hashed form.
[ES] Passwords may be at most six characters long.
answer: [ES] Passwords are only stored in hashed form.

question: [ES] Which of the following programs are web servers? (Choose two.)
[ES] Which of the following Linux Distributions is derived from Red Hat Enterprise Linux?
[ES] Which of the following statements is true about Free Software?
options: [ES] It is developed by volunteers only.
[ES] It may be modified by anyone using it.
[ES] It must always be available free of charge.
[ES] It is only distributed as a compiled binary.
answer: [ES] It may be modified by anyone using it.

question: [ES] How is a new Linux computing instance provisioned in an laaS cloud?
options: [ES] The standard Linux installer has to be run through a remote console.
[ES] After buying a Linux distribution, its vendor delivers it to a cloud instance.
[ES] The installation has to be prepared in a local virtual machine which is then copied to the cloud.
[ES] The cloud hosting organization provides a set of pre-prepared images of popular Linux distributions.
[ES] A provider-specific configuration file describing the desired installation is uploaded to the cloud provider.
answer: [ES] The cloud hosting organization provides a set of pre-prepared images of popular Linux distributions.

question: [ES] What are the differences between a private web browser window and a regular web browser window? (Choose three.)
options: [ES] Private web browser windows do not allow printing or storing websites.
[ES] Private web browser windows do not store cookies persistently.
[ES] Private web browser windows do not support logins into websites.
[ES] Private web browser windows do not keep records in the browser history.
[ES] Private web browser windows do not send regular stored cookies.
answer: [ES] Private web browser windows do not store cookies persistently.
[ES] Private web browser windows do not keep records in the browser history.
[ES] Private web browser windows do not send regular stored cookies.

question: [ES] What is the preferred source for the installation of new applications in a Linux based operating system?
